com.skyisland.questmanager.player.skill

Class Skill

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skyisland.questmanager.player.skill.Skill
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Skill>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LogReducedSkill, LogSkill, MagerySkill, SpellWeavingSkill, SwordAndShieldSkill

    public abstract class Skill
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Skill>
    A player skill. Skills can pertain to any aspect of the game, from combat to crafting. Implementations are responsible for catching events and acting on them. Implementations are heavily encouraged to use the pre-built skill events rather than the bukkit ones, as they include the ability to transfer information about success/failure between the potential many different skills that may influence an action. While an implementation may override the level-up and experience-gain mechanics of a skill, prebuilt ones are included in this class to allow a uniform config-specified skill experience. For more information, see the perform(QuestPlayer, int, boolean) method.

    • Method Detail

      • perform

        public void perform(QuestPlayer participant,
                    int actionLevel,
                    boolean fail)
        Adds experience to the skill, standardized as the specified amount for performing an action of level actionLevel and either succeeding or failing, as determiend by fail
        Parameters:
        actionLevel - The level of the action that was performed. Maybe cooking salmon is a lvl 30 task, for example
        fail - whether or not the action was failed. May or not award xp on failure, as determined by config

      • getIcon

        public abstract org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getIcon()
        Returns an icon to be used as a display icon for the skill in the player skill menu. All names and lore are wiped away when rendering for the inventory. Enchantment, durability, etc are not

      • getDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getDescription(QuestPlayer player)
        Get a pre-formatted description that can be sent to the user. Message should contain a brief description followed by any specifics defined by the Skill. For example, the TwoHandedSkill should have details about what the current hit chance and bonus damage is.

      • getConfigKey

        public abstract java.lang.String getConfigKey()
        Returns a key that can be used to figure out what skill information is being looked at in a player config file. The key can be simple, but should try to be unique. For example, two-handed skill could have "two_handed"

      • setAttributeModifier

        public static void setAttributeModifier(org.bukkit.attribute.AttributeInstance attribute,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        double amt)
        Sets the provided attribute up with a modifier by the given name (overwriting one if it exists) for the given amount. This is done under the AttributeModifier.Operation#ADD_SCALAR operation!
